definition: powder/cosmetic face powder/food prepared from starch/noodles or pasta made from any kind of flour/whitewash/white/pink

sentences.english: The receptive apex of the pistil of a flower, on which pollen is deposited at pollination.
sentences.chinese: 雌蕊花柱頂部，授粉時花粉被旋轉於此。

sentences.english: As a result, fewer of the plants are being pollinated and bearing fruit.
sentences.chinese: 因此，得以授粉並結果的植物越來越少。

sentences.english: Optimal time for hand pollination was within 2 to 3 days after flower opening.
sentences.chinese: 單花序開放後2～3天內是人工授粉的最佳時期。

sentences.english: That is because honey bees pollinate food crops of all kinds.
sentences.chinese: 因爲我們大部分的農作物都是靠它們來授粉的。

sentences.english: The process is called "sporulation, " which is different from pollen's pollination.
sentences.chinese: 過程被稱爲“孢子”，這不同於花粉的授粉。

sentences.english: Bushels of ripe cherries spring forth from trees pollinated by honeybees.
sentences.chinese: 蜜蜂爲櫻桃樹授粉，孕育出大量成熟的櫻桃。

sentences.english: However, after manual pollination the treatedspikes set seeds up to 90%.
sentences.chinese: 然而，在人工授粉後的結實率可以達到90%以上。

sentences.english: The pollination combinations of 12 sand-pear cultivars of southern China were tested for pollination efficiency in this experiment.
sentences.chinese: 對南方砂梨12個品種不同的授粉組合進行測交。

sentences.english: Objective To evaluate the pollination characteristic on Chinese bellflower.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討桔梗授粉特性。

sentences.english: The flowers cross-pollinated creating a new plant species.
sentences.chinese: 花朵異花授粉而創造出新植物品種。

sentences.english: This eliminates the possibility of self- pollination.
sentences.chinese: 這減少出現自花授粉的可能性。

sentences.english: Fertilization started at the 6th days after pollination.
sentences.chinese: 授粉後6天開始出現雙受精作用。

sentences.english: One-third of food crops rely on insect pollination.
sentences.chinese: 三分之一的莊稼須依賴昆蟲授粉。

sentences.english: The earlier the pollination, the higher the fruit set.
sentences.chinese: 開花後授粉越早，座果率越高。

sentences.english: Indeed, as I mentioned last week, many grasses are pollinated by the wind.
sentences.chinese: 確實，如我上週所說，許多草本植物都靠風授粉。

sentences.english: In its native habitat, Hoya blossoms are pollinated by night-flying insects.
sentences.chinese: 在它的原生地，球蘭的花是靠夜飛蟲授粉的。

definition: to sprout/to come out (of seedling)/to bud
tiller (stem at the base of grass plants)
